creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Elizabeth and Willard Clark
description: towering, multi-leveled mountain peak at R; shallow cliff with three-legged, white and red structure at UL; lower, multi-leveled mountain peaks at LL; bent human figure with blue top, white bottom, holding a walking stick at LR; mountains dotted with foliage; inscription at UL
markings: UL edge: square intaglio: 有恪之印{Yūkako no in} (Yūkako’s seal); UL edge, square relief: 聱牙斎｛Gōga sai｝ (Gōga the Buddhist); LLC, rectangular relief: 画竹三昧｛Gachiku Zanmai｝(Nothing but painting bamboo everyday)
title: Landscape with Scholar and Empty Pavilion
